intro: Ricinocarpos mitchellii, commonly known as Mitchell's rock cress, is a small flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are small, white or pale yellow, and it produces pods that contain seeds. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
